meanings.definition: A bank or embankment built to prevent flooding.
meanings.sent1: The stopbank held back the rising water during the storm.
meanings.sent2: The town built a stopbank along the river to protect against floods.
meanings.sent3: The stopbank was like a shield against the angry river.
meanings.sent4: The stopbank stood strong like a guardian against the floodwaters.
meanings.sent5: The stopbank was a barrier that kept the town safe from the flood.

meanings.definition: To build or reinforce a stopbank.
meanings.sent1: They stopbanked the river to prevent flooding in the area.
meanings.sent2: The engineers stopbanked the vulnerable areas along the riverbank.
meanings.sent3: I stopbanked the stream with rocks to divert the water.
meanings.sent4: She stopbanked the creek with sandbags to protect her garden.
meanings.sent5: We stopbanked the canal to control the water flow.

meanings.definition: The act of stopping or preventing flooding with a stopbank.
meanings.sent1: The stopbanking of the river saved the town from disaster.
meanings.sent2: The successful stopbanking prevented the river from overflowing.
meanings.sent3: The stopbanking operation was a race against time.
meanings.sent4: The community celebrated the effective stopbanking efforts.
meanings.sent5: The stopbanking project was a crucial defense against the flood.
